definitions: To let or make something fall vertically.
To intentionally stop holding or carrying something.
To fall or allow to fall to a lower position.
To decrease in amount, level, or intensity.
To stop discussing or dealing with something.
To leave someone or something at a particular place.
To omit or leave out something.
To give birth to (an animal, especially a lamb or calf).
examples: He might drop out of school.
They plan to drop the charges.
Can you drop me off at the store?
The ewe will drop her lamb soon.
